meanings.definition: Gathered closely together in a group or cluster.
meanings.sent1: The bunched flowers looked beautiful in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The bunched grapes were ready to be turned into delicious wine.
meanings.sent3: The bunched socks made it hard to find a matching pair.
meanings.sent4: The bunched clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton balls.
meanings.sent5: The bunched stars in the night sky sparkled like diamonds.

meanings.definition: To gather or form into a tight group or cluster.
meanings.sent1: She bunched her hair into a neat ponytail before going for a run.
meanings.sent2: The children bunched together to listen to the storyteller.
meanings.sent3: He bunched up his socks and threw them playfully at his friend.
meanings.sent4: The team bunched their efforts to complete the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bunched around the fountain, creating a colorful display.
